newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Eurodollars edge up on post-payrolls buying.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Eurodollars edge up on post-payrolls buying.

text.p: SIMEX Eurodollar futures bucked a recent downtrend to end slightly firmer on Monday on follow-through buying after last week's gains in Chicago.
Dealers said the market was reassured by the release of U.S. employment data on Friday showing a slight rise in hourly wages despite a higher than expected increase in non-farm payrolls in February.
Non-farm payrolls jumped 339,000 last month against a revised 247,000 rise in January, while the jobless rate slipped to 5.3 percent from 5.4 percent.
"We might see a couple of days of continued strength on the back of Friday's rally but I'd expect a return to the downtrend by the end of the week," said a dealer with a U.S. house.

Analysts were divided over the prospects of a U.S. interest rate hike, but many expected the Federal Reserve to act pre-emptively and raise the fed funds rate by 25 basis points to 5.50 percent at its policy-making meeting on March 25.
The dealer said December Eurodollars were likely to be firmly capped at 93.90. They ended at 93.825 against their IMM close at 93.800 on volume of 5,220 lots.
Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures were little changed in listless trade after failing to find any inspiration in the Nikkei's losses.
Dealers said the market was also unmoved by news that two of Nomura Securities' directors had been involved in apparently illegal deals, which weighed on Tokyo stocks.
"This kind of news has been coming out of Japan for the last couple of years. There's nothing too shocking about it," said the trader.
December Euroyen was quoted at 99.18 at 1110 GMT against its IMM close at 99.19 on low volume of 2,316 lots. June JGBs settled at 125.36 against their opening 125.30.
